documents.name: Terms of Service
documents.text:
Terms of Service

Last update June 22, 2017. These are the terms of service you are agreeing to when you enrol in and/or when you are using the services of VPNLand Inc. Please Note In this agreement, the term “You” means you the “Subscriber/User”, and the term “We” or “Our” means VPNLand Inc, its owners, employees, agents, and any others involved with VPNLand Inc. As a subscriber of our services, you agree that:

  1. VPNLand (former Blacklogic VPN) does not impose any kind of limits on P2P traffic, but should we receive a DMCA copyright infringement notice you as a customer will be notified and you as a customer will be legally responsible for your own actions. Also, P2P downloads are not allowed through our US (American) VPN Servers under any circumstances. We reserve the right to disable your VPN account if we suspect that you you are involved in P2P downloads through our US VPN Servers
  2. All new accounts are created within 10 (ten) minutes. Some orders may be selected for additional fraud check.
  3. All recurring payments are final and non-refundable (Please see our Cancellation/Refund Policy)
  4. Refunds may be claimed if the service doesn’t work on PCs, Mac OS, Android, BlackBerry and iPod/iPhone devices. If the service doesn’t work on other devices (any kind of routers, third party OSs, etc.), no refunds will be granted
  5. You agree to receive newsletters and other commercials from VPNLand by e-mail
  6. You agree with recurring billing plans
  7. You must be a real card holder and use only your credit card to pay for the service. Payments made from “brother/sister”, “friend”, “and any other relative” credit cards/PayPal account will be put on hold until further investigation
  8. You will not use our services to hack or attack other computers, servers, or networks on the internet.
  9. You agree that you will not use our services to scan (eg. port scanning, running proxy hunters) or break into other computers, servers, or networks on the internet.
  10. You agree that you will not use our services to transmit viruses/trojans/worms, etc. to other computers on the internet.
  11. You agree not to hack our servers and resources.
  12. Lifetime VPN users are not allowed to download more than 100 MB per calendar day. Lifetime VPN users are not allowed to make more than five (5) connections per calendar day. If we suspect that a Lifetime VPN user violates any of our rules we reserve the right to upgrade the service to full Premium VPN (recurring billing at regular pricing) or terminate Lifetime VPN accounts
  13. You agree not to use our services for receiving and the distribution of pirated copyright materials, such as, but not limited to Pirated DVDs (such as movies), Pirated CDs (such as music), Pirated Softwares. This includes, but not limited to the following: The trading, selling, bartering, sharing, transmitting or receiving, of such materials.
  14. You will not use our services to send out unsolicited or fraudulent materials. This includes, but not limited to the following: Sending unsolicited emails (ie SPAM mail), mass-marketing mails (even they are in a opt-in list), hate mail, unsolicited instant messages, unsolicited SMS, or identity theft or scam related materials, etc. Sending emails through port 25 from any of our secure servers are strictly prohibited.
  15. You will not use our services to engage in child pornography activities of any sort. This includes, but not limited to trading, bartering, selling, transmitting child pornography to others, or receiving the materials from others, etc.
  16. You will not use our services for any type of criminal activities. This includes but not limited to the following: Engage in the use of stolen credit cards, stolen bank/debit cards, stolen charge cards, stolen bank accounts, stolen online payment accounts (eg. PayPal accounts). Sending out phishing/pharming/identity theft emails, distributing spyware, viruses, worms. Selling, buying, bartering, exchanging, distributing identity theft information (eg. stolen bank accounts, stolen credit card numbers). Selling, buying, bartering, exchanging, distributing information on how to hack, crack, or otherwise break-in into networks, servers, phone networks/systems, computers. Selling, buying, bartering, exchanging, distributing information on how to steal satellite or cable tv signals, or the sale of equipment enabling others to steal satellite or cable tv signals, etc.. Anything involving blackmail, extortion, murder, rape, etc., etc.
  17. You will not promote or encourage criminal or terrorist activities of any sort.
  18. You will not use our services to threaten or harass others.
  19. You agree that you will not run any resource intensive programs that will interfere in the usage of our services by our users.
  20. You agree not to share your account with others. You will be responsible for all the activities involving your account. You can use your account on as many computers as you like, but you can have only one connection at a time for your account. Simultaneous connections for the same account from different computers are not allowed.
  21. You agree that our services offered to you is provided as a “as is” basis, with no warranties whatsoever. We are not liable for any direct, indirect, consequential, inconveniences, or whatsoever damages, or loss of profit, that may arise from the use of our services. No refunds will be given.
  22. We cannot and do not guarantee the speed of our services. We also cannot and do not guarantee that you will have uninterrupted services. We have no control and cannot guarantee on how the internet will perform in your area. We are not liable for any direct, indirect, consequential, inconveniences, or whatsoever damages, or loss of profit, that may arise from the use of our services. No refunds will be given if you are dissatisfied with our services.
  23. We are not in any shape or form liable for damages of any sort (realized or unrealized) resulting from the use of, or through the use of, or arising from the use of, or the inability to use the VPNLand Inc. services pertaining to any registered user.
  24. In any event, VPNLand Inc. shall never be liable for any monetary damages beyond what the user paid to VPNLand Inc. and this will not include court costs or attorney fees irrespective of any statues or laws that may be interpreted otherwise.
  25. We reserve the right terminate your account without notice or refund if we receive any complaints about your activities from other users or internet service providers (ISPs).
  26. We reserve the right to terminate your account/services at any time for any reason
  27. We keep log files on our servers for only 5 days for the reasons of security. After that the log files are deleted from our servers. The log files are only used for monitoring servers performance, identifying software bugs, identifying any potential security breaches, and for the purpose of identifying abusive users. The log files are not used for monitoring or censoring your internet activities. We respect your privacy. We are not interested in what you do on the internet.
  28. You have the right to claim for a $10 credit (if you read the Rules in full), which will be added to your VPN account. 😉 Please email to: info at Blacklogic dot com
  29. We reserve the right to terminate any contract at anytime for any reason. We reserve not to provide any explanations.
  30. We reserve the right to make amendments or modifications to our Terms Of Use Agreement. This will become binding and it will be your responsibility to periodically check for updates and abide by the terms.
  31. * email us: info at Blacklogic dot com

This is our binding agreement when you agree to these terms of service. The main goal of our service is to protect your privacy. WE DO NOT condone or promote criminal activities of any sort. If you violate any of our terms, we reserve the right to terminate your service without any advance warning or notification. NO REFUNDS OR CREDITS WILL BE GIVEN. If you violate any of our terms that involve criminal activities, you will forfeit all the privacy and confidentiality privileges that our service provides. NO REFUNDS OR CREDITS WILL BE GIVEN.

documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy Policy

Introduction: VPNLand Inc. respects each individual’s right to personal privacy. We will collect and use information through our Web site and products only in the ways disclosed in this statement. This statement applies solely to information collected at VPNLand Inc.’s Web site, and through VPNLand Inc. merchant providers (Stripe and PayPal). Our postal address is: P.O. box 45005, 5845 Yonge St. Toronto, ON, M2M 4K3 We can be reached via e-email at privacy@VPNLand.com This is our binding agreement when you agree to these terms of service. Last update July 13, 2018

What information we collect
  • Your name
  • Your email address
  • Payment method
  • Your address, your phone number and encrypted value of a credit card number (credit card payments only).
What we do with the information we gather

We require this information to understand your needs and provide you with a better service, and in particular for the following reasons:

  • Internal record keeping
  • Fraud prevention
  • We may use the information to improve our products and services.
  • We may periodically send promotional emails about new products, special offers or other information which we think you may find interesting using the email address which you have provided.
  • From time to time, we may also use your information to contact you for market research purposes. We may contact you by email, phone, fax or mail. We may use the information to customize the website according to your interests.
Payment processing
  • For credit card payments we use third party payment processors PayPal and Stripe respectively. We forward information submitted on our website to these providers via encrypted and secure channels for fast and accurate payment processing
    • Stripe Privacy policy can be located here: https://stripe.com/privacy
    • PayPal privacy policy can be located here: https://www.paypal.com/va/webapps/mpp/ua/privacy-full
  • We also accept anonymous Bitcoin and Ethereum payments
What information we know and don’t know
  • Our VPN servers periodically send diagnostics information for troubleshooting purposes
  • We may see customers’ real IP addresses in these diagnostics logs, but we are not able to map these IPs to individual customers
  • Our VPN servers do not keep logs.
  • We don’t know what you do online
  • We don’t know your DNS requests
VPNLand VPN Android and iOS applications
  • Our VPN apps are developed to create a secured VPN tunnel from your mobile device to one of our VPN servers
  • We do not collect and we don’t know any device related information (device model, your name or email address, your Apple ID or Google ID, your phone advertiser ID, your phone number and . mobile operator)
  • Our VPN apps do not collect your Internet browsing history, DNS requests and our apps do not spy on you
  • Our VPN apps may periodically send crash reports to us. These crash reports include only diagnostic logs, no personally identifiable information is included in these logs
Security

We are committed to ensuring that your information is secure. In order to prevent unauthorised access or disclosure, we have put in place suitable physical, electronic and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure the information we collect online.

How we use cookies

A cookie is a small file which asks permission to be placed on your computer’s hard drive. Once you agree, the file is added and the cookie helps analyse web traffic or lets you know when you visit a particular site. Cookies allow web applications to respond to you as an individual. The web application can tailor its operations to your needs, likes and dislikes by gathering and remembering information about your preferences.

We use traffic log cookies to identify which pages are being used. This helps us analyse data about web page traffic and improve our website in order to tailor it to customer needs. We only use this information for statistical analysis purposes and then the data is removed from the system.

Overall, cookies help us provide you with a better website, by enabling us to monitor which pages you find useful and which you do not. A cookie in no way gives us access to your computer or any information about you, other than the data you choose to share with us. You can choose to accept or decline cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. This may prevent you from taking full advantage of the website.

Links to other websites

Our website may contain links to other websites of interest. However, once you have used these links to leave our site, you should note that we do not have any control over that other website. Therefore, we cannot be responsible for the protection and privacy of any information which you provide whilst visiting such sites and such sites are not governed by this privacy statement. You should exercise caution and look at the privacy statement applicable to the website in question.

Controlling your personal information

You may choose to restrict the collection or use of your personal information in the following way:

  • if you have previously agreed to us using your personal information for direct marketing purposes, you may change your mind at any time by letting us know using our Contact Us information

We will not sell, distribute or lease your personal information to third parties unless we have your permission or are required by law to do so. We may use your personal information to send you promotional information about third parties which we think you may find interesting if you tell us that you wish this to happen.

You may request details of personal information which we hold about you under the Data Protection Act 1998. A small fee will be payable. If you would like a copy of the information held on you please email us this request using our information.

If you believe that any information we are holding on you is incorrect or incomplete, please write to or email us as soon as possible, at the above address. We will promptly correct any information found to be incorrect.
